column2:
NOUN

mass noun
1archaic Malaria or another illness involving fever and shivering.  
‘‘We have just moved our camp out of the cypress swamp where the men were fast succumbing to the malaria ___ and fevers at an astonishing rate,’ recorded Capt. Henry Ankey, 4th Iowa Infantry.’

ADJECTIVE

Mathematics 
Relating to or in the form of a plane. 平面の
‘___ surfaces’  
‘The resulting graph is ___, that is can be drawn in the plane without any edges crossing.’

NOUN

Chemistry 
A positively charged ion, i.e. one that would be attracted to the cathode in electrolysis.  
‘When two atoms swap electrons to produce a ___ and an anion, the two ions are attracted to each other.’
